March 20th, 1952
Mr. Jim Mile*
119 Gregory Hall
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Jimt
I have your note of March 11th, which was inadvertently
mislaid.
I think it would be a wonderful idea If you prepared a
book for the benefit of the members of the Board at Columbus. I
know that I was very much Impressed, and I ascertain that those
members of the Board who have not yet been exposed to this display
of headquarters efficiency might well be indoctrinated with
salubrious results.
Since I will not be at Columbus, the entire operation
will be under the jurisdiction, charge and control of Graydon.
By copy of this letter, he is asked to ratify this request, or
to indicate to you that he does not consider it necessary.
With befct wishes.
Cordially,
Seymour If. Siegel
